text: Walligan is a locality in the Fraser Coast Region, Queensland, Australia. == Geography == Walligan is relatively flat land approximately 10 metres above sea level. Approximately half of the land is developed freehold land and is used as acreage blocks for semi-rural residences with some agricultural use. The remainder still in government ownership, much of it being part of the Vernon Conservation Park which occupies . == History == Sugar cane waiting to be loaded onto the train at Walligan railway siding, circa 1924 The Hervey Bay railway line opened in 1896 passing through Walligan where there was a railway station. Passenger services ended in 1973 but the line continue to be used for freight until the line's closure in 1993. It is now used as a mobility corridor for pedestrians, cyclists and mobility scooters. == References == == External links == Category:Fraser Coast Region Category:Localities in Queensland
title: Walligan
